intro: Penstemon rex, commonly known as the royal penstemon, is a striking perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink and red. The plant produces lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Penstemon rex thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a standout addition to any botanical collection.
